My bill to #StopWallStreetLooting would hold private equity firms responsible for their companies – including in the health industry. And Congress should pass #MedicareForAll so nobody goes broke paying a medical bill that pads the pockets of insurance execs & Wall St bankers.

Almost 2/3 of US hospitals outsource physician staffing, many to companies owned by private equity firms. @RepMarkPocan, @RepLloydDoggett & I want to know more about the role those firms play in the sharp rise in surprise out-of-network medical bills.

Nobody having a heart attack or stroke picks their ambulance or ER doc. But when a hospital outsources its physician staffing or ambulance services to a private-equity-owned company, patients can get stuck with outrageous medical bills. It's obscene. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2019/10/18/elizabeth-warren-takes-wall-streets-role-our-surging-medical-bills/ …

Sec. @BetsyDeVosED has given a free pass to every swindler & crook trying to make a buck off America’s students & teachers. Now she’s choking the program designed to help keep teachers from getting crushed by decades of debt. I'll say it again, Sec. DeVos: do your job or resign.

I’ll give you one guess who’s responsible for obstructing student debt relief for teachers & other public servants. (Hint: it’s the Secretary of Education who doesn’t believe in public education.) https://www.npr.org/2019/10/15/769326896/exclusive-turf-war-blocked-cfpb-from-helping-fix-student-loan-forgiveness-progra …

But most borrowers never got the help. Last month, @USGAO reported @usedgov is STILL rejecting 99% of Temporary Expanded PSLF applications. The Trump admin has only spent 3.8% of the emergency funding Congress set aside to help public service borrowers. https://www.npr.org/2019/09/05/754656294/congress-promised-student-borrowers-a-break-then-ed-dept-rejected-99-of-them …

I’ve been fighting to fix the PSLF problem from the moment I heard about it – & I led the expansion of PSLF funding by $700 million over 2 years to forgive the student loan balances of people caught in this mess & enrolled in the wrong program. https://www.insidehighered.com/quicktakes/2018/05/24/new-fix-public-service-loans …

Starting in 2007, our country made a promise to public servants: pay your student loans for 10 years & the balance would be wiped out. But as the 10-year point hit, people who thought they were enrolled in PSLF discovered they weren’t. It’s a nightmare. https://www.npr.org/2018/09/21/650508381/data-shows-99-of-applicants-for-student-loan-forgiveness-denied …

Secretary @BetsyDeVosED & the Trump admin wrecked the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program for teachers & other public servants. @usedgov needs to explain why borrowers aren’t getting the help Congress made available & how they're planning to fix this. pic.twitter.com/KKb20Ga3PA

Workers of color – especially women – are more likely to have unpredictable work schedules, face cancelled shifts, work consecutive closing & opening shifts, & be part-time workers. #SchedulesThatWork is about basic dignity & fairness for all workers. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/16/upshot/unpredictable-job-hours.html …

The #SchedulesThatWork Act would set some ground rules for workers’ schedules:
🗓️ Workers should get their schedule 2 weeks in advance
🗓️ No retaliation against workers who ask for schedule changes
🗓️ Workers have a right to rest between shifts

More than half of hourly workers get their work schedules with less than a week’s notice, making it tough to go to school, keep child care, & pay the bills. I’m reintroducing the #SchedulesThatWork Act with @RosaDeLauro for some economic security for working families. pic.twitter.com/C2UrLYsCiN

.@RepCummings was a fearless leader for social, economic, & racial justice, a giant for the people of Baltimore, & my dear friend & longtime partner. Sending my love to his beloved wife Maya, his children, his incredible staff, & everyone mourning the loss of our champion.

Government can be a powerful force for good – but only when it works for the people. It’s time to end lobbying as we know it & padlock the revolving door between our government & giant corporations. And I’ve got a bill for that. #endcorruptionnow https://www.propublica.org/article/we-found-a-staggering-281-lobbyists-whove-worked-in-the-trump-administration …

For most of America’s history, when our companies did better, our workers did better – and America built a thriving middle class. The Accountable Capitalism Act will help realign our skewed market incentives so companies & workers can once again do well together.

181 CEOs signed a @BizRoundtable non-binding pledge to account for workers & consumers in their decisions. I’m urging companies like @Amazon, @Walmart, @GM, @JPMorgan, @ATT, & @Comcast to keep that promise by supporting our Accountable Capitalism reforms. https://www.warren.senate.gov/oversight/letters/senator-warren-asks-ceos-to-honor-their-commitments-to-promote-an-economy-that-serves-all-americans …

It also requires billion-dollar companies to obtain a federal charter requiring directors to consider the interests of ALL their stakeholders, including employees, customers, & their communities. That charter can be revoked if a company has egregious & repeated illegal conduct.

The Accountable Capitalism Act holds businesses accountable to their employees, not just shareholders:
✅Requires workers to elect 40% of board 
✅Restricts board & execs’ company stock sales
✅Requires 75% of execs & shareholders' approval for political expenditures

Year after year, corporate profits soar for executives & shareholders – but workers’ wages barely budge. I’m reintroducing my Accountable Capitalism Act with @repbenraylujan to empower workers & help fix this fundamental problem with our economy. https://www.vox.com/2018/8/15/17683022/elizabeth-warren-accountable-capitalism-corporations …

My #StopWallStreetLooting bill would hold private equity firms responsible for their companies. And we should abolish private prisons & profit incentives that pervert the goal of our justice system.

And the two largest private correctional medical care providers – both owned by private equity firms – have been sued about 1500 times over the past 5 years for “neglect, malpractice, and, in dozens of cases, wrongful injury or death.”

Privatization & consolidation of prison food services means that private equity firms can make big bucks serving food with mold & maggots – & when incarcerated people decide to buy their own food, private equity profits off the commissaries. It’s all a racket.

Private equity’s push into private prisons, detention centers, & prison services companies has helped create monopolies that squeeze families. Think about it: when there’s no competition for prison phone services, a 15-minute call home can cost $25.

Our criminal justice system lets private equity firms rake in billions at the expense of incarcerated people, detainees, their families, & taxpayers. @RepMarkPocan, @RepAOC & I are investigating private equity firms profiteering off prison services. https://www.axios.com/elizabeth-warren-for-profit-prisons-private-equity-2574421e-064a-4155-bcb0-733a87636122.html …
